text:
http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=31718 could be used to create
thumbnails in the asset management tab, and later on also as a general cms feature
creator: gregor@apache.org

text:
In fact, my customer is doing exactly this. 
The online shop has 50GB of high-resolution TIFF images (5-12MB each) which are also used 
for printing brochures. The online catalog have ~10 images for page, and the potential 
customer can request a couple of image sizes in between the hi-res and the thumbnail. 
 
The initial render is very fast (the bottleneck is the disk access in the DB followed by the 
network interface speed.) and due to the nice caching in Cocoon, subsequent renders are 
instant. 
 
The ImageOp Reader requires JDK1.4, and to get TIFF support and some other tidbits, one 
need to install additional providers, available at Sun's site.
creator: niclas@apache.org
andreas@apache.org
